body: Anyone can answer me to this topic ?

That's weird. The same codebase is used to create the binaries for all the platforms. Unfortunately I don't have a Windows machine to check this out.  I'll see what I can do and try to reproduce this issue, may be using VM

I can confirm this bug! Quite weird. Will play around more, dig more around the issue. I can understand how inconvenient this can be ðŸ˜“ 

PS: I used a Virtual Box VM to try it out. Got Windows ISO by reading [this](https://www.pcsteps.com/45-download-windows-7-iso-legally-free-digital-river/) and used [this video](https://youtu.be/cpRTGtCmZUs) for installation. Also installed Firefox and Sublime and of course helm v2.14.3 and edited `PATH` environment variable to pick up `helm` and `subl` executables.

Yep can we get some answers from devs ?

Sure, thanks patiently waiting for response.

I'm working on this bug. Will post here about my findings and also try to raise a PR for the same ðŸ˜„

Found the bug, it's in this line https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/master/pkg/lint/rules/template.go#L109 . We populate the key with `/` but try to read using `\` (the path separator in windows). Tried a fix and it worked

![VirtualBox_Windows 7 Ultimate_19_09_2019_10_48_20](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12808424/65215560-8b317000-dacb-11e9-8ce3-54b0f7a89a80.png)

@mattfarina I have the fix code for this bug but wanted to avoid such issues in the future, so wanted to add tests. I realized that the code has `filepath` function calls and so I can't write any failing test. I could write it if I run the tests in a windows environment where the `filepath` function works differently with `\` as path separator. So, we need to add support to run tests in windows. Do you think we could do it as part of this PR? I think it would be better that way. Or else the fix code is straight forward, but test would give more confidence since I can't keep running commands and testing in windows in a VM. ðŸ˜…

cc @bacongobbler @thomastaylor312 @adamreese 

Please give your opinions about running tests in windows environment too in the CI, to catch some OS specific bugs like this issue.

We've talked about it before but it shouldn't block the PR from going forward. We've fixed windows-specific bugs in the past without the need for Windows CI. AppVeyor was our initial attempt at testing Helm on Windows but due to stability issues we dropped it from the test matrix. I'd suggest opening a new issue to discuss it (we've talked about macOS CI tests as well).

Cool, so I'll just fix it and raise a PR to start with. Will also create a
separate issue for Windows CI and will also link any previous related
issues if I find :)

issue.title: fix lint not failing in windows for bad template yamls

labels.name: size/XS
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 0-9 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: v2.x
labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v2

issue.body:
**What this PR does / why we need it**:
Fixes #6418 

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
There is no test in this PR. One way this can be tested is - if we run tests on windows. As the issue is involved with calling the functions in `filepath` package which works differently in Linux/Unix and in Windows. 

I have manually tested this in Windows in a VM. Let me know if you find any issues. And I must say my confidence level on the PR is not great because of the lack of tests. But I was told we can address that separately in a different issue ðŸ˜„ 

**If applicable**:
- [ ] this PR contains documentation
- [ ] this PR contains unit tests
- [ ] this PR has been tested for backwards compatibility

issue.title: Proposal: CI with windows environment
issue.body:
After seeing issues like #6418 and fixing them, I feel like we could have a CI with Windows Environment

Pros:
1. Platform specific bugs could be caught
Golang is cross platform yes, but we still get bugs because of some platform specific things. It's how things are. Some standard libraries work differently in windows, for example `filepath`. I don't know other examples, so please chip in if you know more

Cons:
1. One more CI pipeline - Another thing to maintain? And I struggled to run `make` in my Windows VM. I used cygwin and tried stuff to make `make` run ðŸ™ˆ . Finally just copy pasted the simple long `go build` or `gox` commands and executed them. I'm not sure how tough it is in general, but it didn't look easy for me

issue.title: Helm3: Lint does not catch bad template yamls

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

issue.body:
Output of `helm version`:
```
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.0-beta.3", GitCommit:"5cb923eecbe80d1ad76399aee234717c11931d9a", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.12.9"}
```

This is related to the issue #6418 occurring in helm v2. Both have the same root cause.

[chart.zip](https://github.com/helm/helm/files/3666518/chart.zip) . The deployment yaml's `kind` key doesn't have `:` after it

```
$ helm lint chart/
==> Linting chart/
[INFO] Chart.yaml: icon is recommended

1 chart(s) linted, 0 chart(s) failed
```

I'll raise a PR for this too!
